column4: When I fullscreen firefox in Ubuntu, I still see the panel at the top.  how do I really fullscreen it?
no, not the firefox toolbar, the gnome-panel
by panel, you mean the navigation toolbar?
the screen manpage and docs don't have any info on it?
there's an option to output a hardcopy file of the session, which I could grep through...
I've not used it, so I'm afraid I'm not much help
it's a really handy way of leaving interactive terminal programs running (mplayer on a server, streamripper, et cetera)
what are the standard dpkg selections for Breezy?  I can't find them listed anywhere.  I'm trying to use dpkg --set-selections to slim down my system.
isn't that funny, why isn't this ubuntu-en ?
